Description: Small slab of limestone, carved into a rectangular shape and incised with a grid, to create a gaming board.
Curator's comments: Without archaeological context, providing a date for this gaming board is very difficult. For another simple gaming board incised on a limestone block, of New Kingdom date, from Deir el-Medina, see Les artistes de pharaon (exhibition catalogue, Paris 2003), 129 [no.71]
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
